definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: The obvious solution is a property tax.
sentences.chinese: 明显的解决方案是开征物业税。

sentences.english: Guangzhou is expected to take the lead in collecting light pollution fees in the country.
sentences.chinese: 广州市将率先在全国开征光污染排污费。

sentences.english: Push forward tax-fee reform and collect new categories of tax.
sentences.chinese: 推动税费改革，开征新税种。

sentences.english: Chapter IV illustrates China's reclassification of the difficulty of duty and the introduction of countermeasures.
sentences.chinese: 第四章阐叙了我国开征遗产税的难点及对策。

sentences.english: There are also many problems on the special oil gain premium levied from 2006.
sentences.chinese: 2006年开征的石油特别收益金也存在不少问题。

sentences.english: The first property taxes on residential housing in several decades have come into effect in Shanghai and Chongqing
sentences.chinese: 几十年后，首次个人住房房产税将在上海和重庆开征。

sentences.english: Reports also suggest leaders will discuss a tax on banks.
sentences.chinese: 报道称领袖们会讨论对银行开征一项新税。

definition: personal income tax (abbr. for 個人所得稅|个人所得税)
to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
